Fourth, funding for adaptation brings in both direct and indirect global benefits through many different pathways (Table 1), such as, bio-physical (shifts in eco-systems/species range, transboundary river basins), trade disruptions, financial instability, and human displacements (Sundin 2014). Better monitoring and prediction of climate change, better understanding of impacts on human and ecosystem health, etc. are examples of global benefits. Also, adaptation measures may prevent potentially huge climate-induced displacement, regarded as an indirect global benefit (Pickering and Rubbelke 2014). Table 1
